definitions.definition: Happening through bad luck , or because of some unfortunate event .
examples: He unfortunately placed his hand on a loose brick.
There were an unfortunately large number of misprints.

definitions.definition: Used (as a parenthetical word, often a sentence adverb ) to express disappointment , compassion , sorrow , regret ,  or grief .
examples: The houses which burned down could have been saved. Unfortunately , the fire truck had broken down on the way.

main_definition: Happening through bad luck , or because of some unfortunate event .
secondary_definitions: Used (as a parenthetical word, often a sentence adverb ) to express disappointment , compassion , sorrow , regret ,  or grief .
